I.  THE PROPOSED PROJECT 
 
1.   The Chennai–Kanyakumari Industrial Corridor: Power Sector Investment Project1 will 
strengthen  power  transmission  connectivity  between  the  southern  part  of  the  Chennai–
Kanyakumari Industrial Corridor (CKIC) and the northern part of the CKIC by augmenting the 765 
kilovolt (kV) and 400 kV networks. This will allow more power including renewable energy to be 
evacuated from new generation facilities in the south CKIC to the energy hungry north CKIC. The 
project  will  also  enhance  the  institutional  capacity  of  TANTRANSCO  by  (i)  supporting  the 
implementation of a financial restructuring plan (FRP) to restore the financial sustainability of 
TANTRANSCO; (ii) facilitating the introduction of gender sensitive workplace practices; and (iii) 
building TANTRANSCO’s capacity to monitor the environmental and social impacts of power 
transmission projects. 
. 
2.  The outputs of the project include:  
 
(i)  Output 1: Transmission link from southern Chennai–Kanyakumari Industrial 
Corridor  to  load  centers  in  northern  Chennai–Kanyakumari  Industrial 
Corridor  established.  This  output  will  establish  a  765  kV  substation  in 
Virudhunagar and 765 kV power transmission link between the power generation 
hub in the Madurai–Thoothukudi area (southern part of the CKIC) and load centers 
in the northern parts of the CKIC. 
 
(ii)  Output 2: Pooling substation established in Thoothukudi District. This 
output will establish a pooling substation to receive electricity generated 
from power plants in the Thoothukudi district.  
 
(iii)  Output 3:  Financial sustainability and institutional capacity of TANTRASCO 
improved. To be delivered through this transaction technical assistance (TA), this 
output will (i) assist Tamil Nadu Transmission Corporation Limited (TANTRANSCO) 
in implementing the  financial restructuring plan (FRP) to restore its financial 
sustainability; (ii) support the implementation of a financial management action plan 
to  improve  the  financial  management  capacity  and  corporate  governance  of 
TANTRANSCO; and (iii) facilitate the introduction of gender-sensitive workplace 
practices,  and  (iv)  enhance  the  capacity  of  TANTRANSCO  to  monitor  the 
environmental and social impacts of transmission projects. 
 
3.  The main project is estimated to cost $700,000 million. The government has asked the 
Asian Development Bank (ADB) to provide a loan of $451 million to finance the supply and 
installation  cost  of  the  substations  and  transmission  lines  included  in  the  project.  The 
implementing  agency  (TANTRANSCO)  will  mobilize  counterpart  funds  amounting  to 
$202.5 million to pay compensation for right-of-way for transmission lines, land acquisition for 
substations, financial charges during implementation, and project management expenses.  
 
 
 
 
 
                                                
1 Formerly Tamil Nadu Power Transmission Improvement Project.

2 
 
II.  THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
A.  Justification 
 
4.  ADB’s Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF-other sources) will finance transaction 
TA of $650,000 attached to the main project. The proposed TA will finance output 3 of the main 
project. The objectives of the proposed transaction TA are to (i) enhance TANTRANSCO’s 
financial management capacity; (ii) implement the FRP; (iii) facilitate gender-sensitive workplace 
practices, and (iv) enhance the capacity of TANTRANSCO to monitor the environmental and 
social impacts of transmission line projects.   
 
5.  It is proposed that TA resources, rather than a loan, finance these activities as these 
activities do not contribute positive financial returns. TANTRANSCO is a regulated entity, which 
means that a regulator must approve its expenditures and borrowing plans. The regulator would 
be unlikely to allow the financing of capacity building activities through borrowings.  
 
B.  Outputs and Activities 
 
6.  Output 1: Implementation of financial restructuring plan and financial management 
action plan supported. The consultants contracted for this purpose will assist TANTRANSCO in 
implementing the FRP and in particular confirming the intercompany adjustments to be made in 
consultation with tax authorities, external auditors, and the Tamil Nadu Electricity Regulatory 
Commission. In addition, this output will support implementation of key aspects of the financial 
management action plan.   
 
 
7.  Output 2: Gender-sensitive workplace practices promoted. This output will support 
TANTRANSCO to undertake a needs assessment to identify interventions to make the executing 
agency (TANTRANSCO) a more gender-sensitive workplace, and support implementation and 
monitoring of some of these measures. The consultant contracted for this component will, upon 
agreeing with TANTRANSCO on the key interventions, monitor their implementation.  
 
8.  Output 3: Capacity of Tamil Nadu Transmission Corporation Limited to monitor 
environmental and social impacts enhanced.  The consultants contracted for this component 
will  prepare  a  monitoring  framework  for  all  transmission  line  projects  undertaken  by 
TANTRANSCO and will prepare semiannual safeguard monitoring reports for ADB-financed 
transmission lines.   
 
C.  Cost and Financing 
 
9.  The TA is estimated to cost $700,000 of which $650,000 will be financed on a grant basis 
by ADB’s Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF-other sources). The key expenditure items 
are listed in Appendix 1. 
 
10.  TANTRANSCO will provide counterpart support in the form of counterpart staff and other 
in-kind contributions.  
 
D.  Implementation Arrangements 
 
11.  ADB will administer the TA and will select, supervise, and evaluate consultants, and 
procure goods.

3 
12.  TANTRANSCO will be the executing agency and implementing agency of the TA. The TA 
will be implemented over a 24-month period commencing in December 2019 and ending in 
November 2021.

14.  Consulting services. ADB will engage the consultants following the ADB Procurement 
Policy (2017, as amended from time to time) and its associated project administration instructions 
and/or staff instructions.2 The TA will require 8 person-months of international consulting inputs 
and 124 person-months of national consulting inputs. ADB will recruit consultants as required.  
 
15.  The  disbursements  under  the  TA  will  be  made  under  ADB’s  Technical  Assistance
